title: Premium Indian Cafe QR Menu (Mobile-First Digital Book UI)

requirements.summary: Implement a premium, distinctive mobile-first menu UI with warm minimalist Indian hospitality aesthetics (English-only).
acceptanceCriteria: The UI looks premium and distinctive (not a default template) with warm neutrals, generous whitespace, subtle cultural touches, and polished details (shadows/borders/rounded corners).
The layout is optimized for 375‚Äì428px widths and does not produce horizontal scrolling at those sizes.
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell that renders the digital-book menu experience (header + animated section pages + footer) with a mobile-first layout and no horizontal overflow.
Create a minimal premium header component (cafe name + tagline) with warm, modern styling and restrained visual hierarchy.
Create a minimal footer component with a short premium note (English-only), consistent spacing, and subtle separators.
Create a layout wrapper to enforce consistent spacing rhythm, max width for mobile, and safe-area padding (top/bottom) without introducing horizontal scroll.

requirements.summary: Apply a single coherent theme using warm neutral backgrounds and #D97706 as the sole accent color across the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Accent color usage is consistent across the UI (e.g., prices, highlights, badges) and does not introduce additional competing accent colors.
Background uses warm neutrals; cards use pure/subtle warm white; text uses deep charcoal/black with strong contrast.
No purple gradient-on-white look is used.

file_operations.description: Create the global Tailwind entry stylesheet (imported by main.tsx) defining warm-neutral CSS variables and setting #D97706 as the single accent via theme variables; ensure high-contrast foreground text and no purple gradient styling.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens for the cafe theme (e.g., additional semantic colors or shadows if needed) while keeping #D97706 as the only accent color and preserving mobile-first spacing consistency.
Implement card-level styling that consistently uses the warm theme tokens and the single accent color (prices/highlights) without introducing competing accents.

requirements.summary: Implement typography with exactly two Google Fonts (serif headings + sans body) and a clear mobile hierarchy for titles, items, prices, and descriptions.
acceptanceCriteria: Exactly 2 Google Fonts are used: serif for headings and sans-serif for body.
Menu item names render at ~1.2‚Äì1.4rem with medium-bold weight; prices are bold and use the accent color; descriptions are ~0.9‚Äì1rem and readable.
Typography spacing (line-height, margins) supports quick scanning on mobile.

file_operations.description: Add exactly two Google Font imports (one elegant serif for headings and one clean sans-serif for body), and ensure they are applied globally via CSS variables/classes.
Define font-family stacks for headings (serif) and body (sans), plus consistent type scale and line-height for section titles, item names, prices, and descriptions optimized for 375‚Äì428px screens.
Apply the defined typography hierarchy in a section page: section title heading, item name sizing/weight, price styling (bold + accent), and description sizing/spacing for scanability.

requirements.summary: Create seven menu sections as separate navigable pages with realistic Indian items, mostly vegetarian, priced ‚Çπ30‚Äì‚Çπ400, with appetizing one-line descriptions.
acceptanceCriteria: All seven sections exist and each is its own navigable page in the digital-book experience.
Each section has ‚â•3 items (preferably 4) with authentic Indian naming and one-line appetizing descriptions.
Prices are displayed in rupees (‚Çπ) and fall within ‚Çπ30‚Äì‚Çπ400.

file_operations.description: Add static menu data defining the 7 sections (Hot Beverages, Cold Beverages, Breakfast & Snacks, Street Food, Main Course, Breads, Desserts) and 3‚Äì4 realistic items each (authentic Indian names, mostly vegetarian, ‚Çπ30‚Äì‚Çπ400, English descriptions), including per-item metadata (veg/non-veg, badges, image URL).
Render the seven sections as separate 'pages' in the digital-book experience, driven by the static menu data.
Wire MenuBook into the app so all seven sections are reachable as distinct pages in the horizontal sliding experience.

requirements.summary: Implement menu item cards with circular images/placeholders (95‚Äì110px, 3px border, subtle shadow) and veg/non-veg indicator at top-left of the image; generous spacing/dividers.
acceptanceCriteria: Every item shows a circular image or circular placeholder at 95‚Äì110px with a visible 3px border and subtle shadow.
Veg indicator uses #16A34A; Non-veg indicator uses #DC2626; indicator is a small square with a dot, positioned top-left of the image area.
Cards have generous whitespace and consistent rhythm; items are separated by ~30‚Äì40px spacing (or equivalent).

file_operations.description: Implement the specified circular image frame (95‚Äì110px diameter, 3px border, subtle shadow) with a top-left veg/non-veg indicator (square with dot; veg #16A34A, non-veg #DC2626), plus generous padding and item-to-item spacing/dividers.
Create a dedicated veg/non-veg indicator component to guarantee consistent sizing, positioning (top-left over image), and exact color usage.
Ensure section pages lay out item cards with a consistent 30‚Äì40px vertical rhythm (or equivalent) and subtle separation lines/spacing without clutter.

requirements.summary: Add optional badges: Bestseller, Chef's Special, and Spicy (üå∂Ô∏è) with compact consistent styling and no clutter.
acceptanceCriteria: Some items across the menu demonstrate each badge type (Bestseller, Chef's Special, Spicy üå∂Ô∏è).
Badges are visually consistent, small, and do not reduce readability of name/price/description on mobile.

file_operations.description: Mark a subset of items across multiple sections with badges (Bestseller, Chef's Special, Spicy üå∂Ô∏è) and optional spice-level metadata to demonstrate each badge type without overuse.

Create a compact badge row component for item cards that renders Bestseller, Chef's Special, and Spicy (üå∂Ô∏è) consistently in the theme; if using shadcn-ui Badge, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire ItemBadges into each item card in a way that preserves mobile readability and does not crowd the name/price/description.

requirements.summary: Build the multi-page digital-book interaction with horizontal slide transitions and subtle entry animations; keep scrolling smooth and stable.
acceptanceCriteria: Switching between sections animates with a smooth horizontal slide (booklet-like), not an abrupt jump.
Within a page, content reveals use subtle fade-in/slide-up animations and does not feel distracting.
Scrolling inside a section page is smooth and remains stable during page transitions.

file_operations.description: Implement horizontal sliding page transitions between sections (booklet-like) with stable scroll handling per page and smooth gesture/tap navigation.
Create a lightweight reveal animation wrapper (subtle fade/slide-up) for page-entry content, designed to be unobtrusive and compatible with reduced-motion settings.
Apply subtle entry reveals to key content blocks (title + list/cards) and ensure internal scrolling remains smooth during/after page transitions.

requirements.summary: Provide compact, always-discoverable navigation controls (next/prev and/or pager) that do not cover the menu and work well on small screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation controls are always discoverable but occupy minimal screen real estate and do not block key content.
Users can navigate forward/back between pages with taps; controls have accessible touch targets on mobile.
Current section/page is indicated (e.g., dots or small label) without a large overlay.

file_operations.description: Create compact navigation controls (prev/next + small pager indicator such as dots/label) optimized for mobile touch targets; if using shadcn-ui Button, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire MenuPager into the digital-book UI so navigation is always available, minimal, non-blocking, and indicates the current section/page.

requirements.summary: Use high-quality Unsplash image URLs with optimization params for fast loading; provide a tasteful circular placeholder and avoid layout shift.
acceptanceCriteria: Menu items display images from Unsplash URLs that include optimization parameters (w/h/fit crop).
If an image fails to load or is not provided, a visually consistent circular placeholder is shown.
The page remains performant and visually stable (no layout shift when images load).

file_operations.description: Populate item images with direct Unsplash URLs that include optimization parameters (e.g., w=400&h=400&fit=crop) and ensure coverage across the menu while allowing some items to demonstrate placeholder fallback.
Create a circular image component that sets explicit width/height for stability, handles load errors, and renders a themed circular placeholder when missing/failing.
Use CircularImage in item cards to ensure consistent circular cropping, fast-loading optimized images, and no layout shift.

requirements.summary: Add a minimal themed header (cafe name + tagline) and footer note; keep unobtrusive, including if sticky.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows cafe name and tagline and does not dominate the viewport on mobile.
Footer shows a short, tasteful line consistent with the premium tone.
If the header is sticky, it remains minimal and does not overlap core content during scroll or page transitions.

file_operations.description: Ensure header includes cafe name + tagline with minimal height and optional sticky behavior that remains unobtrusive and does not overlap content during transitions/scroll.
Ensure footer renders a small premium note (e.g., ‚ÄúFreshly made with love‚Äù or ‚ÄúScan to order.‚Äù) consistent with the theme.
Wire header and footer into the overall layout with safe spacing so they never cover key menu content on small screens.

requirements.summary: Ensure accessibility and mobile quality: semantic structure, contrast, readable type, no horizontal scroll, and reduced-motion support.
acceptanceCriteria: All sections use a clear heading hierarchy and accessible labels for navigation controls.
On 375‚Äì428px widths, there is no horizontal scrolling and text remains readable.
Animations are subtle and a reduced-motion preference disables or significantly reduces motion effects.

file_operations.description: Use semantic structure for section pages (clear heading hierarchy, section landmarks where appropriate) and ensure readable font sizes and contrast on mobile.
Add accessible labels/aria attributes for navigation controls and ensure touch targets meet mobile usability while remaining visually minimal.

Add reduced-motion CSS handling (prefers-reduced-motion) to disable or significantly reduce transition/animation intensity, and enforce overflow-x hidden safeguards to prevent horizontal scrolling at 375‚Äì428px.
Create a small hook to detect reduced-motion preference and let MenuBook/RevealOnEnter reduce or disable motion accordingly.
Respect reduced-motion preference by reducing/disabling slide and reveal transitions, while keeping navigation functional and scroll stable.
